answers.answer: No, on treatment anything I could force myself to eat was considered a good thing and a big deal - however even if I could not eat much I always made sure to take the pills with something that containned fat so I could keep as much of that riba in me at all times as possible.I did eat an awful lot of ice cream because it didn't hurt my stomach and came in a zillion flavors and I had to maintain some weight I was like a skeleton. And ice pops were great for the dehydration. Other than that.......if you can eat it and it's not booze - eat it. :)Oh I did avoid fried foods because they hurt my stomach and spicy things because I had the horrid tongue ulcers and it hurt like h3ll!!!!!!!
Awesome! I've been looking for a reason to fill my deep freeze with ice cream! :)The doctor never mentioned not wanting to eat as being a "side effect".  Is it pretty common?

For the first 8 weeks I could not eat enough. Hungry all the time but never gained any lbs. nygirl got me eating ice cream shakes, yummy. I try to hit Dairy Queen every day. The last 3 weeks I have not been as hungry but I still eat like normal.
it depends on the relative health of the liver - if you are stage 3-4 proper diet and nutrition become very important
I gained 10 lbs in 12 weeks of tx.  Nothing tasted right but high carb foods.  Not high fat  though.  I am concerned that too much sugar during tx can have a neg effect on outcome.
diabetes has a negative effect on tx outcome - sugar carbs processed foods are very unhealthy and should be avoided late in disease progression

question: I was told that I should do as much as I can to be healthy, including drinking massive amounts of water, eliminating alchohol, and the like.  I'd like to know if any one has changed their diets while on tx.  If so, what have you incorporated and/or eliminated?
